summary: This document is an email chain from February 2020 discussing a list of outstanding investigative tasks related to a person referred to as 'GM'. The emails focus on scheduling interviews, obtaining records (including from Interlochen and airlines), and clarifying a timeline, specifically regarding a move to NYC. The context suggests pre-charge investigative work.

connections.description: Epstein is reported to have described GM as the 'original girl finder', indicating a prior association and role.

events.title: Scheduled interview
events.description: An interview related to the investigation was scheduled for this date.

events.title: Target interview week
events.description: Aiming to conduct an interview with a person in LA during this week.

events.title: Target interview week
events.description: Aiming to conduct another interview during this week.

locations: Interlochen (likely Interlochen Center for the Arts)
keyFacts: The investigation involves a person referred to as 'GM', whom Jeffrey Epstein described as the 'original girl finder'.
Investigators are actively working on a pre-charge list of tasks, including interviews and obtaining school/airline records to establish a timeline of GM's move to NYC.
Specific records being sought include those from Interlochen and Southwest Airlines, the latter via a subpoena.
The email chain demonstrates coordinated investigative planning among team members in February 2020.
